body: We're marking this PR as stale due to lack of updates in the past few months. If after another couple of weeks the stale label has not been removed this PR will be closed. This stale marker and eventual auto close does not indicate a judgement of the PR just lack of reviewer bandwidth and helps us keep the PR queue more manageable.  If you would like this PR re-opened you can do so and a committer can remove the stale tag.  Or you can open a new PR.  Try to help review other PRs to increase PR review bandwidth which in turn helps yours.

can we re-open this issue?

Hey,
Thank you for the comments again, I opened a new PR with better version of it:
https://github.com/apache/nifi/pull/5028

Hi @sjyang18 ,

may I ask what's missing for this PR to be merged? the failing Ubuntu test failed because of another component which is not related to this functionality. Please clarify. thx.

Cheers,
removing stale label.  we really should review this one.  looks helpful and easily tested
I'll check it out
Thanks for making updating the logic to check password properties @gresockj, those changes look good.  Do you have any additional feedback @bbende?

I verified that these changes preserve the environment variables from the parent user using the `preserve.environment` variable in bootstrap.conf. This PR would need to be rebased onto 'main' branch, as this PR is made against the 'master' branch which we migrated away from some time ago. I can't see a way to automatically do that through GIthub so it may require @sushilkm to edit this PR or submit a new PR rebased on main branch.
Sure, I will do that.
Reviewing
reviewing...
Thanks @tpalfy merged to main
Rebased against main and addressed conflicting RunNiFi.java.

Hi @driesva 

I got, sorry for the delay... @gerdansantos and I are very busy with our works.

In the next month, we gonna make an effort to update this PR... in the meanwhile, I will discuss with @gerdansantos how we can work together.
@markap14 I'm planning to do another run through of this today and barring any issues intend to merge it. Was there anything else you're wanting to do before I go ahead with that?

I changed the SNMPUtils::getAuth and SNMPUtils::getPriv because according to the snmp4j documentation the auth and priv protocols can be null. The map had already contained the empty string-null key value pair but the optionals threw exception instead of returning the null value. I'll also add default empty string values for the protocols in the SNMPConfigurationBuilder later.

Thanks @jfrazee. No additional changes that I am planning to make. Over the last week, have been spinning up lots of clusters and resizing them in both Azure and a private cloud. Have made a few tweaks as we've run into issues but in the last many iterations we've run into no issues, so I don't have any changes planned. If additional things come up, of course we can address but otherwise I'd say go ahead and merge when you're comfortable with it.
+1 with green build.  please self merge

> +1 with green build. please self merge

Thanks @joewitt!  Confirmed local build success and will merge following successful PR build.

Windows build timed out, but previous run succeeded.

https://github.com/exceptionfactory/nifi/actions/runs/790136090

Merging.
Based on David's input, I'm going to simply use Jetty's KeyStoreScanner and add our own TrustStoreScanner to integrate into the Jetty life cycle.
+1 LGTM, thanks for the fix! Merging to main
The latest round of updates look good @thenatog! I will do some additional runtime verification.

Thanks @gresockj. Closed pull request in favor of https://github.com/apache/nifi/pull/5042. This PR has the contents of this branch plus additional commits, and is pushed against a different branch that represents the Jira number.

Wow.

The 'old school' nifi in me is sad to see this would mean 'commit' goes away.  But the implication this has in achieving better semantics for transaction bounded groups of processors in stateless vs the traditional nifi model which remains unchanged is pretty powerful.  Needs some good attention/testing/eyes on.

@joewitt agreed. Definitely need some good analysis of the changes here. Good news is that the changes fall into 3 categories:
- Updating the API and StandardProcessSession. These are the most critical but pretty low-risk because not a whole lot changed.
- Updating the Processors. This is the largest part of the changeset by far. But tiny changes (mostly 1-liners) to many classes, which makes it look like a lot.
- Updating stateless. This is a big part of the changes, but low risk in that stateless isn't as heavily used yet, as is still pretty immature.
@jfrazee Would you take a look at this PR for me?

This branch/PR was tested in a docker build deployed to ECS where the indicated behaviour of not being able to remove a disconnected (and zombie/gone) node was repeatable 99.99% of the time. After deployment of this branch we were able to successfully remove a zombie/disconnected node via the UI as well as via the toolkit api calls 100% of the time during our test runs
based on feedback/testing +1
I verified the expected behavior before and after the patch.  I was also not able to perform a CSRF attack on my patched local instance.
@naddym I think, this PR is duplicate (check #5024 )

@mattyb149 Can you please also include a testcase of incorrect column ordering while providing values. I ended up creating a duplicate PR https://github.com/apache/nifi/pull/5043. However, an important testcase can be included from there. Thanks.

Oh, Thanks @tonykoval . I didn't know as the PR was created few days back and the issue I worked on was created just yesterday. Will close  this PR as there is already with same implementation #5024 but would like to also include different column ordering testcase in that PR #5024. 

@mattyb149 Please comment if the testcase looks good.
The test case looks good, thank you! I've incorporated it into my PR, which will hopefully be reviewed/merged shortly.
Thanks @mattyb149
Thanks to @gresockj, @naddym, @gardellajuanpablo, @greyp9, and @ldd200888 for the comments and contributions, very helpful!
@markap14 Do you have any additional feedback, or do the latest changes look good?  Thanks!
If someone was going to use these new classes, it might be good to have a readme or something for this part of the code

> If someone was going to use these new classes, it might be good to have a readme or something for this part of the code

Thanks for the feedback @ottobackwards!  Providing some additional documentation would be helpful, although I think it would be better to wait until other components start leveraging this module.  I attempted to provide some high-level abstractions in the `EventSender` and `EventServer` interfaces, but even these interfaces and implementations are geared sending and receiving byte arrays for Syslog messages.  There should be some reuse of these classes for other processors, such as `PutTCP` and `ListenTCP`, among others.  If there are particular components that could use some additional description, feel free to point those out.  However, I expect some changes when it comes to leveraging similar approaches with other components.

Please let me know if you have any additional comments or questions!

> Since you've removed the `@Ignore` it's now failing the check style because it's an unused import. Can you remove the import?

@jfrazee I missed that one, my bad. This should work now.

I'd like to keep the test, but it could be refactored to reflect its intent better.

It is useful to understand the constraints of the locales in which ci-workflow is running.  There are now test cases for each, where the particular fixed issues are better illuminated.  An `Assume` guards a set of `Assert` for each expected locale.

Maybe this organization makes more sense.
Looked over the code and tested out the integration test with a locally installed Vault service, looks good to me. +1

CI on branch successful.  Also ran site against local environment, where "user.region" is unset.

https://github.com/greyp9/nifi/actions/runs/808240028
+1 merged to main

@s9514171 Thank you for the contribution.  Unfortunately it looks like the GitHub automated builds for Java 8 failed, and the failures appear to be related to the new dependency on Xalan.  Were you able to build successfully on Java 8?  These build failures need to be resolved before moving forward.

> LGTM but I'm wondering if changes are required in the NOTICE files as well. For example, in the assembly one, I see:
> 
> ```
>   (ASLv2) Spring Framework
>     The following NOTICE information applies:
>       Spring Framework 4.x,5.x.RELEASE
>       Copyright (c) 2002-2015 Pivotal, Inc.
> 
>   (ASLv2) Spring Security
>     The following NOTICE information applies:
>           Spring Framework 4.0.3.RELEASE
>           Copyright (c) 2002-2015 Pivotal, Inc.
> ```
>
